User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the WorkSessionScheduler application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

role.description: The user's role within the application (e.g., admin, varsity, novice).

id.description: Unique identifier for the Session entity.

hostId.description: Reference to the User hosting the session. (Relationship: User 1:N Session as Host)

clientId.description: Reference to the User attending the session as a client. (Relationship: User 1:N Session as Client)

status.description: The status of the session (e.g., scheduled, completed, cancelled).

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a message within a session.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Message entity.

sessionId.description: Reference to the Session this message belongs to. (Relationship: Session 1:N Message)

senderId.description: Reference to the User who sent the message. (Relationship: User 1:N Message as Sender)

timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the message was sent.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to address the 'Missing or insufficient permissions' error by enforcing authorization independence and role-based access control. The structure uses path-based ownership for user data and a dedicated collection for admin roles. Denormalization is employed to avoid using `get()` in security rules, enabling atomic operations and improving debuggability. Segregation of data into collections with homogeneous security postures simplifies rules and supports secure list operations.

*   `/users/{userId}`: Stores user profiles. Access is restricted to the user themselves (path-based ownership). This addresses the user list error by restricting access.
*   `/users/{userId}/sessions/{sessionId}`: Stores sessions owned by a specific user (either as host or client). This uses path-based ownership to ensure only the user can access their sessions. The `hostId` and `clientId` fields are denormalized from the `User` entity.
*   `/users/{userId}/sessions/{sessionId}/messages/{messageId}`: Stores messages within a session. This continues the path-based ownership, restricting access to participants of the session. The `senderId` is denormalized from the `User` entity.
*   `/roles_admin/{userId}`: A dedicated collection to store admin roles. The existence of a document in this collection grants admin privileges. Existence over content is leveraged.

This structure achieves Authorization Independence by denormalizing authorization-related data (e.g., `hostId`, `clientId`, `senderId`) into subcollections. This eliminates the need for `get()` calls in security rules, enabling atomic operations and improving scalability. The structure supports the required QAPs by segregating data based on access control requirements. Path-based ownership and role-based access using the `/roles_admin` collection ensure that only authorized users can access specific data.
